title: Wonton soup

ingredients.content: ½ - 1 long red chilli, deseeded if preferred, plus extra sliced for garnishing (optional)
1 sprig fresh coriander, (roots, stems and leaves)
120 g pork mince, broken into pieces
20 g dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked in boiling water for 30 minutes, then drained

preparations.content: Place garlic, ginger, spring onion/shallot, chilli and coriander (roots, stems and leaves) into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then repeat chopping <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pork mince and prawns and chop <b>Turbo/0.5 sec/3-4 times<b>.
Add egg yolk, soy sauce, sesame oil and rice wine vinegar and mix <b>1 sec/speed 4<b>. Mixture should be chunky in consistency. Transfer mince mixture into a bowl and set aside.
Grease Varoma dish and tray with peanut oil and set aside.
Place 1 wonton wrapper onto a clean work surface. Place 1 heaped teaspoon of mince mixture in the middle of wonton wrapper.
Brush all edges of the wrapper with a little egg white, then fold wonton wrapper in half diagonally to enclose filling, forming a triangle shape.
Using your fingertips, seal all edges to eliminate any air pockets. Gently pull 2 remaining corners together (over enclosed filling) and press together to seal.
Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers to make approx. 20 wontons (you may have leftover wrappers). Place all wontons into Varoma dish and onto Varoma tray, then set aside.
Place garlic, ginger and spring onions/shallots into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, stock paste, fish sauce and sesame oil and cook <b>15 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Place Varoma with wontons into position and cook <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Set Varoma aside.
Add bok choy, drained shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots and cook <b>2 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Divide wontons between serving bowls, then ladle broth over wontons and garnish with extra sliced chilli before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
